options.content:
# üî• Continuous Profiling with Pyroscope

Pyroscope collects CPU and memory profiles from your applications, helping you identify performance bottlenecks.

## üëâ [Click here to explore profiles](/explore?schemaVersion=1&panes=%7B%22v1b%22%3A%7B%22datasource%22%3A%22pyroscope%22%2C%22queries%22%3A%5B%7B%22refId%22%3A%22A%22%2C%22datasource%22%3A%7B%22type%22%3A%22grafana-pyroscope-datasource%22%2C%22uid%22%3A%22pyroscope%22%7D%2C%22profileTypeId%22%3A%22process_cpu%3Acpu%3Ananoseconds%3Acpu%3Ananoseconds%22%2C%22labelSelector%22%3A%22%7B%7D%22%7D%5D%2C%22range%22%3A%7B%22from%22%3A%22now-1h%22%2C%22to%22%3A%22now%22%7D%7D%7D&orgId=1)

The **Explore** view provides flame graphs, top functions, and time-series of resource usage.

## üì° Integration Endpoint

Send profiles to:

| Setting | Value |
|---------|-------|
| **Server** | `http://<oib-host>:4040` |

For Docker containers on oib-network:
```
http://oib-pyroscope:4040
```

## üéØ Profile Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| **CPU** | Where time is spent executing code |
| **Memory** | Heap allocations and memory usage |
| **Goroutines** | Active goroutines (Go only) |
| **Mutex** | Lock contention (Go only) |
| **Block** | Blocking operations (Go only) |

## üêç Python Integration

```python
import pyroscope

pyroscope.configure(
    application_name="my-app",
    server_address="http://<oib-host>:4040",
    tags={
        "env": "production",
        "version": "1.0.0"
    }
)
```

**Install:** `pip install pyroscope-io`

## üîß Environment Variables

```bash
export PYROSCOPE_SERVER_ADDRESS=http://<oib-host>:4040
export PYROSCOPE_APPLICATION_NAME=my-app
```

## ‚òï Java Integration

```java
import io.pyroscope.javaagent.PyroscopeAgent;
import io.pyroscope.javaagent.config.Config;

PyroscopeAgent.start(
    new Config.Builder()
        .setApplicationName("my-java-app")
        .setServerAddress("http://<oib-host>:4040")
        .build()
);
```

Or use the **Java agent**:
```bash
java -javaagent:pyroscope.jar \
  -Dpyroscope.application.name=my-app \
  -Dpyroscope.server.address=http://<oib-host>:4040 \
  -jar myapp.jar
```

## üìä Understanding Flame Graphs

| Element | Meaning |
|---------|----------|
| **Width** | Time spent in that function (wider = more time) |
| **Height** | Call stack depth (top = entry point, bottom = leaf functions) |
| **Color** | Different code paths or packages |
| **Self Time** | Time in the function itself (excluding calls to other functions) |
| **Total Time** | Time including all child function calls |

### üîç Tips
- **Click** on a block to zoom into that subtree
- **Search** to highlight specific functions
- Look for **wide blocks** at the bottom - these are your hotspots
- Compare profiles over time to spot regressions
